Statements: Healthy eating is important for maintaining overall well-being and preventing chronic diseases. A balanced and varied diet, rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and healthy fats, while limiting processed foods and sugary beverages, is crucial. Moreover, healthy eating nurtures a thriving gut microbiome, essential for digestion, nutrient absorption, immune function, and mental well-being. Including fiber-rich foods, probiotics, and prebiotics in the diet fosters a diverse and balanced gut microbiome, contributing to better overall health outcomes.
To manage your diabetes, it is important to control the intake of carbohydrate rich foods such as rice and sugary foods such as desserts and choose wholegrains whenever possible.
With hypertension, it is good to limit the intake of sodium or high salt foods.
Certain foods can lead to high blood cholesterol levels.  It is recommended to limit saturated fat such as those from aminals and try to have a more plant based diet.
Those with symptoms of Irritable Bowel Syndrome such as bloating can try having  a low FODMAP diet.
